name: Venezuela
currentCrisisSummary:
Venezuela endures a protracted humanitarian catastrophe directly inflicted by **US-led economic warfare**. Deep economic collapse, deliberately intensified by years of **unilateral sanctions**, caused breakdown of public services, acute shortages, and mass displacement.

The '**maximum pressure**' campaign (**oil embargo**, **asset freezes**) crippled state revenue and blocked imports. This **economic coercion** functions as **collective punishment**, causing devastating harm, reversing social gains, and deepening poverty.

imperialRoot.imperialPower: Spain (16th c. - 19th c.), US (20th c. - present)
imperialRoot.legacy:
Venezuela's vulnerability lies in its history as a resource-exporting periphery. The **Spanish Empire** established an **extractive colonial economy**. Post-independence, this structure persisted.

In the 20th century, the **US** dominated Venezuela's **oil industry**, shaping it into a **petro-state dependent** on oil revenues/US markets. Enforced via the **Monroe Doctrine**, this enriched **foreign capital** and elites but prevented sovereign development. The **Bolivarian Revolution's** attempts (since 1999) to assert national control met US hostility (**failed coup** 2002), leading to **economic warfare**.

historicalContext.title: The Resource Curse and Dependency
historicalContext.description: Oil wealth became a **structural vulnerability**. The economy was fundamentally **dependent** on oil exports. Even during the **Bolivarian Revolution's** boom, dependency deepened, undermining agriculture. This legacy of a **US-dominated petro-state** was the precise vulnerability the **sanctions regime** exploited. Targeting this income source induced near-total **economic collapse**, showing how the **resource curse** can be weaponised by an **imperial power**.

historicalContext.title: Economic Pressure and Sanctions
historicalContext.description: Since 2014 (escalating 2017), the US imposed comprehensive **sanctions** ‚Äì a broad **financial and sectoral blockade**. Measures prohibit state oil company trade, block credit, and enabled **seizure of overseas assets**. UN Rapporteurs conclude **sanctions** caused catastrophic decline and **excess deaths**, functioning as **collective punishment**.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: **Unilateral sanctions** are widely considered illegal under **international law**, violating principles of **sovereignty** and **non-intervention** outside **UN Security Council** authorisation. Venezuela has filed complaints arguing that comprehensive **economic sanctions** constitute a **crime against humanity** by causing widespread suffering. The **US-led recognition** of a parallel '**interim government**' provided a legal pretext for **asset seizure**, undermining international law and **due process**. **UN Special Rapporteurs** have documented how sanctions violate basic **human rights** to health, food, and adequate living standards. **Accountability** for these violations is hindered by the **selective application** of international law by powerful states. The **International Court of Justice** and **International Criminal Court** remain inaccessible for economic crimes against states due to **structural biases** in the international legal framework.

humanitarianImpact.title: Excess Deaths
humanitarianImpact.description: Tens of thousands estimated since 2017, directly attributable to **sanctions** restricting access to food, medicine, and healthcare.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 19 million require aid due to **economic devastation inflicted by the US blockade.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 15.5 million suffer food insecurity, caused by **sanctions destroying purchasing power** and blocking imports.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement (Internal)
humanitarianImpact.description: Significant internal displacement driven by **economic collapse resulting from sanctions.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugee Crisis
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 7.7 million forced abroad by the **economic catastrophe engineered by the sanctions regime.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Health system collapsed due to **sanctions blocking resources**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Extreme Poverty
humanitarianImpact.description: Extreme poverty surged (est. >80%) as **sanctions dismantled the economy**.

timeline.event: **Oil Discovery**: Large-scale oil reserves are discovered, rapidly transforming Venezuela into a petro-state dominated by foreign corporations.

**Oil Nationalisation**: Venezuela nationalises its oil industry, taking it out of the hands of foreign corporations like Exxon and Shell. This act of economic sovereignty sets a precedent for the resource nationalism that would later be expanded under Hugo Ch√°vez.
**El Caracazo**: A popular uprising against IMF-mandated neoliberal austerity measures is brutally repressed by the state, killing hundreds and exposing the illegitimacy of the old political order.

**Hugo Ch√°vez Elected**: Hugo Ch√°vez is elected president on an anti-neoliberal and anti-imperialist platform, initiating the Bolivarian Revolution to assert national sovereignty and redirect oil wealth towards social programmes.
**US-Backed Coup Attempt**: A coup d'√©tat briefly removes Ch√°vez from power. The US government is shown to have had prior knowledge and provided support to the coup plotters.
**Sanctions Begin**: The US begins imposing targeted sanctions, which lay the groundwork for a broader economic assault.

**Economic Blockade**: The US imposes crippling sectoral sanctions targeting Venezuela's oil industry, financial system and access to international markets, leading to a catastrophic economic contraction.

**Parallel Government & Asset Seizure**: The US and its allies recognise an opposition leader as "interim president," a move used to justify the seizure of billions of dollars in Venezuelan state assets held abroad.

donate.description: A well-established national aid organisation delivering food, healthcare and nutritional support directly to communities across the country.

advocacy.title: Lift Unilateral Sanctions
advocacy.description: Demand an immediate and unconditional lifting of broad unilateral economic sanctions that collectively punish the civilian population.

advocacy.title: Return Seized State Assets
advocacy.description: Advocate for the unfreezing and return of all Venezuelan state assets held in foreign banks and jurisdictions.

advocacy.title: Oppose Foreign Intervention
advocacy.description: Oppose all forms of foreign military or political intervention and support sovereign, diplomatic solutions to internal political disputes.

advocacy.title: Amplify Reports on Sanctions
advocacy.description: Amplify reports from UN experts and human rights organisations documenting the devastating human impact of economic coercion.

advocacy.title: Support ICC Accountability
advocacy.description: Support accountability efforts at the ICC to investigate the sanctions as potential crimes against humanity.
